p: In the histopathological evaluation, the control group revealed necrosis, inflammatory reaction, and yeast colonization in the affected tissue ( figures 1A and 1B). Figure 1 presents the removal of C. albicans in the tissue after treatment with fluconazole and also a decrease in inflammatory cells. These effects were identical when T. ammi AW was administered, suggesting the anti-inflammatory property of T. ammi AW ( Figure 1D). There was also a healing effect when AW was used, which differentiated AW from fluconazole ( Figure 1D).
